revised_title: Experimental Study of Thermal and Electrical Conductivity of Sodium at Low Temperatures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on two high-purity sodium specimens to measure their thermal and electrical conductivity at low temperatures. They found that the experimental Lorenz curve deviated from modern theories of metallic conduction, and the predicted minimum in thermal conductivity was not observed. The results suggest that lattice vibrations may not conform to the Debye spectrum, and further research is needed to understand the deviations from theory.
